Package com.github.tommyettinger.cringe

Class FoamNoise

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.RawNoise
com.github.tommyettinger.cringe.FoamNoise
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.Serializable
public class FoamNoise extends RawNoise
A RawNoise type that produces more-natural, less-uniform noise.
This is a very-smooth type of noise that can work well using fewer octaves than simplex noise or value noise. It also tends to look similar in lower dimensions and higher dimensions, where some other kinds of noise (such as SimplexNoise) change their appearance quite a bit in 2D vs. 6D.
This tends to be a fairly slow noise to generate, but isn't the slowest here. It also tends to look more like a natural "thing" than a geometric shape, even with just one octave.

      getNoise in class RawNoise
      Parameters:
      x - x position; can be any finite float
      Returns:
      a noise value between -1.0f and 1.0f, both inclusive

    • getNoiseWithSeed

      public float getNoiseWithSeed(float x, int seed)
      Gets 1D noise with a specific seed. This delegates to LineWobble.splineWobble(float, int).
      Overrides:
      getNoiseWithSeed in class RawNoise
      Parameters:
      x - x position; can be any finite float
      seed - any int; must be the same between calls for the noise to be continuous
      Returns:
      a noise value between -1.0f and 1.0f, both inclusive
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if 1D noise cannot be produced by this generator

    • canUseSeed

      Specified by:

    • setSeed

      public void setSeed(int seed)
      Description copied from class: RawNoise
      Sets the seed to the given int, if int seeds are supported. If RawNoise.canUseSeed() returns true, this must be implemented and must set the seed given an int input. If this generator cannot be seeded, this is permitted to either do nothing or throw an UnsupportedOperationException. If this operation allocates or is time-intensive, then that performance cost will be passed along to RawNoise.getNoiseWithSeed(float, int), since that calls this twice unless overridden. In the case where seeding is expensive to perform, setSeed() can still be implemented while RawNoise.canUseSeed() returns false. This makes the RawNoise.getNoiseWithSeed(float, int) methods avoid reseeding, and instead move their inputs around in space.
      Specified by:
      setSeed in class RawNoise
      Parameters:
      seed - an int seed, with no restrictions unless otherwise documented

    • getSeed

      public int getSeed()
      Description copied from class: RawNoise
      Gets the current seed of the generator, as an int. If RawNoise.canUseSeed() returns true, this must be implemented, but if canUseSeed() returns false, this is permitted to either still be implemented (but typically only if it is time- or space-intensive to call getSeed()) or to throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
      Specified by:
      getSeed in class RawNoise
      Returns:
      the current seed, as an int

    • stringSerialize

      public String stringSerialize()
      Description copied from class: RawNoise
      Produces a String that describes everything needed to recreate this RawNoise in full. This String can be read back in by RawNoise.stringDeserialize(String) to reassign the described state to another RawNoise. The syntax here should always start and end with the ` (backtick) character, which is typically used by RawNoise.stringDeserialize(String) to identify the portion of a String that can be read back. The ` character should not be otherwise used unless to serialize another RawNoise that this uses.
      Specified by:
      stringSerialize in class RawNoise
      Returns:
      a String that describes this RawNoise for serialization
      See Also:
      • RawNoise.Serializer wraps this method so registered RawNoise types can be deserialized.

    • stringDeserialize

      public FoamNoise stringDeserialize(String data)
      Description copied from class: RawNoise
      Given a serialized String produced by RawNoise.stringSerialize(), reassigns this RawNoise to have the described state from the given String. The serialized String must have been produced by the same class as this object is.
      Specified by:
      stringDeserialize in class RawNoise
      Parameters:
      data - a serialized String, typically produced by RawNoise.stringSerialize()
      Returns:
      this RawNoise, after being modified (if possible)
      See Also:
      • RawNoise.Serializer uses this method to deserialize any registered RawNoise type.

    • recreateFromString

      public static FoamNoise recreateFromString(String data)

    • copy

      public FoamNoise copy()
      Description copied from class: RawNoise
      Creates a copy of this RawNoise, which should be a deep copy for any mutable state but can be shallow for immutable types such as functions. This almost always just calls a copy constructor.
      The default implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException only. Implementors are strongly encouraged to implement this in general, and that is required to use an RawNoise class with RawNoise.Serializer.
      Specified by:
      copy in class RawNoise
      Returns:
      a copy of this RawNoise
